metadata.title: CVE-2015-2059 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The stringprep_utf8_to_ucs4 function in libin before 1.31, as used injabberd2, allows context-dependent attackers to read system memory andpossibly have other unspecified impact via invalid UTF-8 characters in astring, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idn - 1.28-1ubuntu2.1
libidn11 - 1.28-1ubuntu2.1
libidn11-java - 1.28-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libidn package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.28-1ubuntu2.1').
